doc.name: codeunitOffset
doc.summary: Returns the number of codeunits between the beginning of a value and an occurrence of a specified string.

example.p: condeunitOffset(tCodeUnit, "This is the string to search")

description.overview: Use the codeunitOffset function to find which sentence a string occurs in.

parameter.name: stringToFind
parameter.description: The stringToFind is a string or an expression that evaluates to a string.

parameter.name: stringToSearch
parameter.description: The stringToSearch is a string or an expression that evaluates to a string.

parameter.name: codeunitsToSkip
parameter.description: The codeunitsToSkip is a non-negative integer. If you don't specify how many codeunitsToSkip, the codeunitOffset function does not skip any codeunits.

description.value: The codeunitOffset function returns a non-negative integer.

comments.p: The value returned by the codeunitOffset function is the number of the codeunit where the stringToFind appears in stringToSearch. If the stringToFind is not in stringToSearch, the codeunitOffset function returns zero. If the stringToFind is more than one codeunit, the codeunitOffset function always returns zero, even if the stringToFind appears in the stringToSearch.

If you specify how manycodeunitsToSkip, the codeunitOffset function skips the specified number of sentences in the stringToSearch. The value returned is relative to this starting point instead of the beginning of the stringToSearch.
